sub_topic: Calculation of magnetic field due to a current-carrying coil
message_1: A coil with radius 0.1 meters has 200 turns and carries a current of 3 amps. What is the magnitude of the magnetic field at the center of the coil?
message_2:
To find the magnitude of the magnetic field at the center of the coil, we can use the formula for the magnetic field produced by a current-carrying loop:

B = (μ₀ * N * I) / (2 * R)

where B is the magnetic field, μ₀ is the permeability of free space (4π × 10⁻⁷ Tm/A), N is the number of turns, I is the current, and R is the radius of the coil.

Plugging in the given values:

B = (4π × 10⁻⁷ Tm/A * 200 * 3 A) / (2 * 0.1 m)

B = (4π × 10⁻⁷ Tm/A * 600 A) / 0.2 m

B = (2.4π × 10⁻⁴ Tm) / 0.2 m

B = 12π × 10⁻⁴ T

The magnitude of the magnetic field at the center of the coil is approximately 12π × 10⁻⁴ T or 3.77 × 10⁻³ T.
